016package com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.internal.thirdparty;
017
018import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
019import java.lang.reflect.Field;
020import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
021import java.lang.reflect.Method;
022import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
023import java.util.Arrays;
024
025/**
026 * The code of this class is copied from class <code>org.springframework.util.ReflectionUtils</code> 
027 * in order to avoid additional dependencies to other projects.
028 * <p>  
029 * The name is prefixed with <code>Zzz</code> to avoid confusion in case the
030 * original classes are also available in classpath.  
031 */
032
033/**
034 * Simple utility class for working with the reflection API and handling reflection exceptions.
035 * <p>
036 * Only intended for internal use.
037 * 
038 * @author Juergen Hoeller
039 * @author Rob Harrop
040 * @author Rod Johnson
041 * @author Costin Leau
042 * @author Sam Brannen
043 * @since 1.2.2
044 */
045public abstract class ZzzReflectionUtils {
046
047    /**
048     * Attempt to find a {@link Field field} on the supplied {@link Class} with the supplied <code>name</code>. Searches
049     * all superclasses up to {@link Object}.
050     * 
051     * @param clazz
052     *            the class to introspect
053     * @param name
054     *            the name of the field
055     * @return the corresponding Field object, or <code>null</code> if not found
056     */
057    public static Field findField(Class<?> clazz, String name) {
058        return findField(clazz, name, null);
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Attempt to find a {@link Field field} on the supplied {@link Class} with the supplied <code>name</code> and/or
063     * {@link Class type}. Searches all superclasses up to {@link Object}.
064     * 
065     * @param clazz
066     *            the class to introspect
067     * @param name
068     *            the name of the field (may be <code>null</code> if type is specified)
069     * @param type
070     *            the type of the field (may be <code>null</code> if name is specified)
071     * @return the corresponding Field object, or <code>null</code> if not found
072     */
073    public static Field findField(Class<?> clazz, String name, Class<?> type) {
074        ZzzAssert.notNull(clazz, "Class must not be null");
075        ZzzAssert.isTrue(name != null || type != null, "Either name or type of the field must be specified");
076        Class<?> searchType = clazz;
077        while (!Object.class.equals(searchType) && searchType != null) {
078            Field[] fields = searchType.getDeclaredFields();
079            for (Field field : fields) {
080                if ((name == null || name.equals(field.getName())) && (type == null || type.equals(field.getType()))) {
081                    return field;
082                }
083            }
084            searchType = searchType.getSuperclass();
085        }
086        return null;
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * Set the field represented by the supplied {@link Field field object} on the specified {@link Object target
091     * object} to the specified <code>value</code>. In accordance with {@link Field#set(Object, Object)} semantics, the
092     * new value is automatically unwrapped if the underlying field has a primitive type.
093     * <p>
094     * Thrown exceptions are handled via a call to {@link #handleReflectionException(Exception)}.
095     * 
096     * @param field
097     *            the field to set
098     * @param target
099     *            the target object on which to set the field
100     * @param value
101     *            the value to set; may be <code>null</code>
102     */
103    public static void setField(Field field, Object target, Object value) {
104        try {
105            field.set(target, value);
106        } catch (IllegalAccessException ex) {
107            handleReflectionException(ex);
108            throw new IllegalStateException("Unexpected reflection exception - " + ex.getClass().getName() + ": "
109                    + ex.getMessage());
110        }
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Handle the given reflection exception. Should only be called if no checked exception is expected to be thrown by
115     * the target method.
116     * <p>
117     * Throws the underlying RuntimeException or Error in case of an InvocationTargetException with such a root cause.
118     * Throws an IllegalStateException with an appropriate message else.
119     * 
120     * @param ex
121     *            the reflection exception to handle
122     */
123    public static void handleReflectionException(Exception ex) {
124        if (ex instanceof NoSuchMethodException) {
125            throw new IllegalStateException("Method not found: " + ex.getMessage());
126        }
127        if (ex instanceof IllegalAccessException) {
128            throw new IllegalStateException("Could not access method: " + ex.getMessage());
129        }
130        if (ex instanceof InvocationTargetException) {
131            handleInvocationTargetException((InvocationTargetException) ex);
132        }
133        if (ex instanceof RuntimeException) {
134            throw (RuntimeException) ex;
135        }
136        handleUnexpectedException(ex);
137    }
138
139    /**
140     * Handle the given invocation target exception. Should only be called if no checked exception is expected to be
141     * thrown by the target method.
142     * <p>
143     * Throws the underlying RuntimeException or Error in case of such a root cause. Throws an IllegalStateException
144     * else.
145     * 
146     * @param ex
147     *            the invocation target exception to handle
148     */
149    public static void handleInvocationTargetException(InvocationTargetException ex) {
150        rethrowRuntimeException(ex.getTargetException());
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Rethrow the given {@link Throwable exception}, which is presumably the <em>target exception</em> of an
155     * {@link InvocationTargetException}. Should only be called if no checked exception is expected to be thrown by the
156     * target method.
157     * <p>
158     * Rethrows the underlying exception cast to an {@link RuntimeException} or {@link Error} if appropriate; otherwise,
159     * throws an {@link IllegalStateException}.
160     * 
161     * @param ex
162     *            the exception to rethrow
163     * @throws RuntimeException
164     *             the rethrown exception
165     */
166    public static void rethrowRuntimeException(Throwable ex) {
167        if (ex instanceof RuntimeException) {
168            throw (RuntimeException) ex;
169        }
170        if (ex instanceof Error) {
171            throw (Error) ex;
172        }
173        handleUnexpectedException(ex);
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Rethrow the given {@link Throwable exception}, which is presumably the <em>target exception</em> of an
178     * {@link InvocationTargetException}. Should only be called if no checked exception is expected to be thrown by the
179     * target method.
180     * <p>
181     * Rethrows the underlying exception cast to an {@link Exception} or {@link Error} if appropriate; otherwise, throws
182     * an {@link IllegalStateException}.
183     * 
184     * @param ex
185     *            the exception to rethrow
186     * @throws Exception
187     *             the rethrown exception (in case of a checked exception)
188     */
189    public static void rethrowException(Throwable ex) throws Exception {
190        if (ex instanceof Exception) {
191            throw (Exception) ex;
192        }
193        if (ex instanceof Error) {
194            throw (Error) ex;
195        }
196        handleUnexpectedException(ex);
197    }
198
199    /**
200     * Throws an IllegalStateException with the given exception as root cause.
201     * 
202     * @param ex
203     *            the unexpected exception
204     */
205    private static void handleUnexpectedException(Throwable ex) {
206        throw new IllegalStateException("Unexpected exception thrown", ex);
207    }
208
209    /**
210     * Make the given field accessible, explicitly setting it accessible if necessary. The
211     * <code>setAccessible(true)</code> method is only called when actually necessary, to avoid unnecessary conflicts
212     * with a JVM SecurityManager (if active).
213     * 
214     * @param field
215     *            the field to make accessible
216     * @see java.lang.reflect.Field#setAccessible
217     */
218    public static void makeAccessible(Field field) {
219        if ((!Modifier.isPublic(field.getModifiers()) || !Modifier.isPublic(field.getDeclaringClass().getModifiers()) || Modifier
220                .isFinal(field.getModifiers())) && !field.isAccessible()) {
221            field.setAccessible(true);
222        }
223    }
224
225    /**
226     * Make the given method accessible, explicitly setting it accessible if necessary. The
227     * <code>setAccessible(true)</code> method is only called when actually necessary, to avoid unnecessary conflicts
228     * with a JVM SecurityManager (if active).
229     * 
230     * @param method
231     *            the method to make accessible
232     * @see java.lang.reflect.Method#setAccessible
233     */
234    public static void makeAccessible(Method method) {
235        if ((!Modifier.isPublic(method.getModifiers()) || !Modifier.isPublic(method.getDeclaringClass().getModifiers()))
236                && !method.isAccessible()) {
237            method.setAccessible(true);
238        }
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * Make the given constructor accessible, explicitly setting it accessible if necessary. The
243     * <code>setAccessible(true)</code> method is only called when actually necessary, to avoid unnecessary conflicts
244     * with a JVM SecurityManager (if active).
245     * 
246     * @param ctor
247     *            the constructor to make accessible
248     * @see java.lang.reflect.Constructor#setAccessible
249     */
250    public static void makeAccessible(Constructor<?> ctor) {
251        if ((!Modifier.isPublic(ctor.getModifiers()) || !Modifier.isPublic(ctor.getDeclaringClass().getModifiers()))
252                && !ctor.isAccessible()) {
253            ctor.setAccessible(true);
254        }
255    }
256
257    /**
258     * Attempt to find a {@link Method} on the supplied class with the supplied name and no parameters. Searches all
259     * superclasses up to <code>Object</code>.
260     * <p>
261     * Returns <code>null</code> if no {@link Method} can be found.
262     * 
263     * @param clazz
264     *            the class to introspect
265     * @param name
266     *            the name of the method
267     * @return the Method object, or <code>null</code> if none found
268     */
269    public static Method findMethod(Class<?> clazz, String name) {
270        return findMethod(clazz, name, new Class[0]);
271    }
272
273    /**
274     * Attempt to find a {@link Method} on the supplied class with the supplied name and parameter types. Searches all
275     * superclasses up to <code>Object</code>.
276     * <p>
277     * Returns <code>null</code> if no {@link Method} can be found.
278     * 
279     * @param clazz
280     *            the class to introspect
281     * @param name
282     *            the name of the method
283     * @param paramTypes
284     *            the parameter types of the method (may be <code>null</code> to indicate any signature)
285     * @return the Method object, or <code>null</code> if none found
286     */
287    public static Method findMethod(Class<?> clazz, String name, Class<?>... paramTypes) {
288        ZzzAssert.notNull(clazz, "Class must not be null");
289        ZzzAssert.notNull(name, "Method name must not be null");
290        Class<?> searchType = clazz;
291        while (searchType != null) {
292            Method[] methods = (searchType.isInterface() ? searchType.getMethods() : searchType.getDeclaredMethods());
293            for (Method method : methods) {
294                if (name.equals(method.getName())
295                        && (paramTypes == null || Arrays.equals(paramTypes, method.getParameterTypes()))) {
296                    return method;
297                }
298            }
299            searchType = searchType.getSuperclass();
300        }
301        return null;
302    }
303}
